text: {'Press J to jump to the feed. Press question mark to learn the rest of the keyboard shortcuts'}
{'Do you think British food is as bad as the internet suggests?'}
{'Do you think British food is as bad as the internet suggests?'}

{"I feel like I'm taking crazy pills with the recent internet culture towards British food being bland. I remember growing up having all sorts of interesting and varied dishes, yeah we had our share of beans on toast but it wasn't quite as beige as the zeitgeist suggests."}
{'Log in or sign up to leave a comment'}
{'A reminder to posters and commenters of some of our subreddit rules'}
{"Don't be a dickhead to each other, or about others, or other subreddits"}
{'Assume questions are asked in good faith, and engage in a positive manner'}
{'No medical advice or mental health (specific to a person) content'}

{'The American stereotype of British food being bad started during WW2, when American forces were stationed over here. During rationing.'}
{"but it's not just an American view of British cuisine. it existed before ww2 in European countries at least"}
{'Rationing also continued in Britain right until 1954. So there was a nearly a whole generation who grew up making meals out of scraps'}
{'However, unlike the Yanks we went back to proper chocolate, they kept there chocolate shit due to $$$'}

{'I’ve got English cookbooks that are pre-war and you can tell the war pretty much wiped out our collective ability to cook. Not to mention that because of industrialisation we stopped foraging and as foods became mass produced fresh produce and the local butchers, greengrocer and baker were replaced by supermarkets and prepackaged shite.'}
{'It irritates me endlessly how mainland Europe have amazing seasonal and local produce almost everywhere and it’s affordable.'}
{'Here we pay absurd prices for really poor quality.'}
{"It's also why the stereotypical view of Germany in USA is mainly Bavarian because of where they fought and occupied during WW2."}

{"What's ironic is that british food is often accused of being bland, but American food (not cajun, creole, or Texan barbecue) is the blandest shit on the planet: bleached chicken, stark white mashed potatoes, meatloaf and gravy, biscuits and gravy, pea-heavy casseroles; it's like an entire national cuisine consisting only of low chew-resistance baby food (and for those without teeth)."}
{'Trouble is Rationing continued for a good decade after the war, we were the most bankrupt country in Europe.'}

{'I’m British. Lived in America last twenty years and I can’t wait to get home and eat fresh healthy foods of different cultures. Local farms. Fresh cream. The food in my part of the USA is utterly utterly awful yet the Americans constantly joke about how bad the food is in England even though most have never left their own state.'}
{'even though most have never left their own state.'}
{'I was blown away when I found out that nearly 40% of Americans have never had a passport.'}
{'Ive moved to england about 6 months ago.'}
{'I honestly dont like most of the food here. But I come from LA where food is abundant and my diet wasn\'t usually "american" foods.'}

{"I really miss the variety of foods but I am in the smaller town here. I can't say how itll be in bigger cities yet. Only visited and its just been okay, but hvaen't been there long enough to say for sure."}
{'The US has all of this too. What part of the US do you live in?'}
{"mrs and I found it really difficult to find healthy places to eat in New York that didn't drain the bank account. Plenty of sweaty $1 pizza though"}
{'I love this. Someone asks why there\'s an assumption that British food is known for being bad, your response is "..But.bu..look at how bad American food is!"'}
{'Not anymore, no. Obviously the stereotypes come from the 1940s when Americans first visited and people were literally on rations, same reason for the bad teeth stereotype'}

{'Certain cultures are definitely more passionate about food, Italy for example, but I definitely won’t take any shit from a yank who thinks the height of cuisine is covering a triple cheeseburger in sugar.'}
{'Brits have the fifth best teeth in the world, almost twice the ranking of Americans... Always find the stereotype funny.'}
{"Americans don't just eat burgers and plastic cheese, the Italians don't just eat pasta, Germans don't just eat sausages and British people don't just eat bland slops."}
{"But it's the internet, people are either saying it for a laugh or because they're idiots."}
{'But the french certainly just eat snails and frog legs.'}

{'This so right. And I’d also say you can’t base a country’s food on what those with lower income can afford. Cheap food like fast food and cheese wiz isn’t a typical persons diet in the US if they can afford it.'}
{'I freakin love sticky toffee pudding and I’ve had the most heavenly ham and leek pie at a pub. Every country has its delicious dishes and stereotypical foods that are looked down upon.'}
{"Germans eat so much bread and sausage though, it's crazy. They have sausage like 3-4 nights a week in some households, that's really normal. Madness."}
{'It’s fine, you wait and see what the internet thinks about having a washing machine in the kitchen…'}
{"Wait a minute, is that an unusual thing outside of the UK? We all can't afford utility rooms 😖"}
{'What the fuck’s a washing machine doing in a kitchen? Jesus, I need a drink.'}

{'Someone posted a picture of a pie saying “it’s disgusting brits think this counts as cuisine” and I replied “you eat cheese from a can” and I got literal death threats and multiple people agreeing that all British people drink from the Thames, like legit 100% convinced we all got our water supply from the Thames'}

{'I\'m gonna go ahead and say you might be exaggerating "death threats". But you are right. I watch a lot of cooking shows and invariably the American ones focus on cheese, sugar, bit more cheese, then some salt. A little sugar to balance the flavour, and then some cheese on top to really finish the dish.'}
{"Americans are extremely sensitive and can't take any criticism. At least the ones on Reddit anyway."}
{'Some areas do take water from the Thames. Though of course it is treated properly first, just like (almost*) every other developed mains water supply'}
{'people agreeing that all British people drink from the Thames'}
{'Considering we can drink our tap water without the need for filters and parts of America have to rely on bottled water, this is ridiculous.'}
{'The response to cheese in can is typically "lol nobody eats this" like they\'re not doing the exact same thing to us with some shitty foods.'}

{"They always find a photo of something rancid from the most toilet-like lower division football ground in the entire country and act like that's what we eat all the time...and then post a photo of something of theirs that's 5 star restaurant quality, bonus if it's a cuisine brought over by immigrants like most major cities in the UK don't have varying levels of immigrant populations either."}

{'We can both do this all day. Pick the most insane shite ever mixed in a bowl and blasted in a microwave and then compare it to the absolute best quality cuisine on offer and claim that this means one or the other country is the superior one.'}

{"The hate for things like beans on toast is unreal. Like, sorry that in your country you were never given pure comfort food when you had an upset tummy as a kid? Sorry you don't know the joy of being hungover and reaching for a fry-up?"}
{'The Thames is one of, if not the, cleanest metropolitan river in the World.'}
{"If anyone buys bottled water in Scotland they're a fucking idiot (a bit hyperbolic, perhaps they just like the convenience). Our tap water is top level stuff."}
{"Food on the other hand... Meh. If you don't like fish, pies, or fried goods, you'll probably just end up eating foreign foods like everyone else. Our pies and fish are chefs kiss tho."}
{'It’s dumb meme, like bad teeth or every American having guns.'}
{'You don’t need to engage with every bit of stupidity on the Internet.'}
{'Americans always come for British teeth when Britain has a higher Dental rating'}
{'Tbf almost half of Americans do own guns 😂'}
{'The stereotype has been about way before the first “meme”.'}
